result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie L Leamy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

Cases 15CF420, 15CM326 & 15CM328 called together at 10:49 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Carrie L Leamy in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement for case 15CF420
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #1 to Retail Theft a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to 943.50(1m)(b) & (4)(a) - 15CF420

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered Counts #1 & #2-15CF420, Count #1-15CM326; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM328 and Counts #3 & #4-15CF420 

On Counts #1 & #2-15CF420, Count #1-15CM326, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No possession of any dangerous weapons
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--No possession or consumption of alcohol - may possess as required for employment purposes
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores EXCEPT as required for employment purposes
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $548 payable to Wal-Mart (15CF420)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee  (15CF420)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (15CM326)
--To pay $133 subpoena fees (15CM326)


Days credit for time already served: 0 days - 15CF420
Days credit for time already served: 2 days - 15CM326
Recess: 11:04 am

ADDRESS INFO for Carrie L Leamy
Current: W9430 Porter Dr, Cambridge, WI 53523 United States  (Effective: 12-14-2015)
Prior: 608 1/2 E Cady St, Watertown, WI 53094
Defendant in custody//Duplicate Original Warrant returned by JCSD

Cases 15CM326 and 15CM328 called together at  10:13am [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Carrie L Leamy in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court and Counsel discuss a warrant that has been issued for Ms. Leamy under 968.09(1).

As to the State's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Arguments given by Counsel
--The Court modifies Ms. Leamy's bond to have a $500 cash bond in each file, for a total of $1000, with same non-monetary conditions.

Atty. Hagemann requests a Speedy Trial; both cases can be scheduled for Trial, with back to back Trial dates.
ADA Teuber indicates the State does not rule out the possibility of a Motion for Joinder of the cases.  
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 10:28am

NEXT: As to Both Cases: (1)FSSC on 1/5/16 at 10:30 am (2) Jury Trial on 1/11 and 1/12/16 at 8:30am

[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Carrie L Leamy in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Ms. Leamy indicates that she recently had a surgical procedure; requests additional time to retain counsel.
The Court directs Mr. Leamy to go to the Public Defender's office today, if she is not eligible for their services then to Petition the Court for Counsel

Cases 15CM326 & 15CM328 called together at 11:06 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Carrie L Leamy in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; Address confirmed accurate; Miss Leamy indicates that her DOB is 10/3/1984; charge & penalties recited; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the $150 CASH bond, already posted, to cover BOTH files, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Daniel Leamy
-Booking
ADA Fryatt orally motions to amend the complaint to reflect correct DOB of 10/3/1984-Court grants
